Welcome to AdvantuEchoServer’s documentation!¶

class EchoServer.EchoModeEnum(value, names=None, *, module=None, qualname=None, type=None, start=1, boundary=None)¶

Bases: IntEnum

An enum for the mode of logging to use.

Description:

The log_mode can be one of the following: LOG_CONSOLE, LOG_FILE, LOG_BOTH

LOG_CONSOLE: Log to the console.

LOG_FILE: Log to a file.

LOG_BOTH: Log to both the console and file.

LOG_BOTH = 2¶
LOG_CONSOLE = 0¶
LOG_FILE = 1¶
class EchoServer.EchoServer(host='localhost', port=7777, log_mode=EchoModeEnum.LOG_BOTH, log_file='EchoServer.log', log_level=10)¶

Bases: object

A simple Python EchoServer – it receives data from a client and echoes it back.

Parameters:

  • host (str) – The host to bind to.

  • port (int) – The port to bind to. (1-65535)

  • log_mode (EchoModeEnum) – The type of log to use.

  • log_file (str) – The file to log to.

  • log_level (int) – The level of log to use.

Description:

A simple EchoServer implementation. The log_mode can be one of the following: logging.DEBUG, logging.INFO, logging.WARNING, logging.ERROR, logging.CRITICAL

log(message, *args)¶

Log a message. See EchoModeEnum for the log modes that are supported. :param message: The message to log. :param args: Other arguments to log. (similar to print) :return None

serve()¶

Start the server. :return None

class EchoServer.IntEnum(value, names=None, *, module=None, qualname=None, type=None, start=1, boundary=None)¶

Bases: int, ReprEnum

Enum where members are also (and must be) ints

class EchoClient.EchoClient(host='localhost', port=7777)¶

Bases: object

EchoClient Class

Provides a simple client for communicating with an EchoServer. Provides send() and recv() methods for sending and receiving messages.

close()¶

EchoClient close() Method - Closes the connection to the server. :return: (None)

host = None¶
port = None¶
recv()¶

EchoClient recv() Method - Receives a message from the server. :return: (str) The message received from the server.

send(msg)¶

EchoClient send() Method - Sends a message to the server. :param msg: (str) The message to send. :return: (None)

sock = None¶
